importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The outage started early Monday, around 3 a.m. ET, when Amazon reported increased error rates and latencies affecting its facility in Northern Virginia.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The outage began at approximately 3 a.m. ET and persisted into the evening, with Amazon reporting ongoing disruptions as of Monday evening.

keyTakeAways: A massive outage at Amazon Web Services (AWS) disrupted major websites and apps across the internet, including Duolingo, Roblox, Fortnite, Coinbase, Robinhood, Venmo, Perplexity, and ChatGPT.
The root cause was an error in an early-morning software update to AWS's DynamoDB database service, located in Northern Virginia.
The failure in DynamoDB triggered a chain reaction of service failures due to AWS’s critical role as the backbone of internet infrastructure.
AWS holds approximately 30% of the global cloud computing market, making it a dominant and essential provider for businesses worldwide.
Experts warn that reliance on a few major tech providers like Amazon, Microsoft, and Google creates significant vulnerability—when one fails, the ripple effects can be widespread and damaging.
This incident highlights a growing concern in tech: the fragility of digital infrastructure due to over-reliance on centralized cloud computing services.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A massive outage at Amazon Web Services (AWS) began early Monday morning, affecting key websites and apps such as Duolingo, Roblox, Fortnite, Coinbase, Robinhood, Venmo, Perplexity, and ChatGPT. The root cause was a software update error in AWS's DynamoDB database service, located in Northern Virginia, which triggered a chain reaction of service failures. AWS, which holds about 30% of the global cloud computing market, serves as a critical backbone for internet operations, and this outage highlights the systemic vulnerability of modern businesses to failures in centralized cloud infrastructure. Experts warn that while relying on major cloud providers offers convenience and strong security, it also creates significant risks—when one provider fails, the ripple effects can disrupt financial services, gaming platforms, social media, and even healthcare operations. This incident echoes earlier outages like the 2024 CrowdStrike failure, reinforcing growing concerns about over-concentration in a few technology providers.
title: Outage at Amazon Web Services disrupts websites across the internet
